sentences: Hänen haavansa oli syvä ja vaati ompelua.
Oppilaiden ylpeys koulustaan on hyvin syvä.
context: The Finnish word 'syvä' is an adjective meaning 'deep'. It can also refer to something being profound. The word declines based on case, as shown in the dictionary definition, and has comparative forms like 'syvempi' (deeper) and superlative form 'syvin' (deepest). You can see possessive forms are also available for different people.
